title: Hays manages to keep fees stable as it battles an industry downturn
text:
Hays chief exec Alistair Cox said a global portfolio kept its head above water

Investors reacted with relief to a tough update from recruiter Hays, which kept its fees stable in the face of a difficult UK private sector.

The fees fell by 1 per cent when analysts had been expecting a 2 per cent fall. It follows profit warnings from recruiters Page and Robert Walters last week.

Liberum analyst Sanjay Vidyarthi said there may be 'some relief' that the results were not even worse. Shares rose 8.1 per cent, or 11.7p, to 155.7p. Last week they reached their lowest point since January following the updates from rivals.

Chief executive Alistair Cox said a global portfolio kept its head above water, with record fees in the US –up 12 per cent – and China – up 7 per cent – despite a trade war between the two.

In the UK net fees fell 4 per cent.

Cox said: 'I am confident we will continue to appropriately balance investing for the long term while managing the more challenging markets we face.'
